theme: From social impact to projects that spark joy

projects.name: KeyPaws
projects.blurb: KeyPaws is my side project that uses AI to protect your computer from cats on your keyboard.

projects.name: Mindfulpuss
projects.blurb: Mindfulpuss is an experimental podcast that encourages you to live life in the meow.

projects.name: Ask EveryDoctor
projects.blurb: At the height of the pandemic I developed a survey tool for campaigning organisation EveryDoctor to track PPE in the NHS.

projects.name: Pembroke House
projects.blurb: Working with designer Rosalba Ellis again, I built a fully customisable website for Pembroke House, a centre for social action and residential community in Walworth.

projects.name: JAMstack Starter
projects.blurb: All web projects share the same foundations. JAMstack Starter condenses my sixteen years of experience building accessible and privacy-friendly websites and apps into an open source starter template to robustly jumpstart new projects.

projects.name: Gwen Hustwit
projects.blurb: Made possible by JAMstack Starter, Gwen's affordable, accessible website—fully editable and customisable via a CMS—was put together in a single day of collaboration in Crystal Palace.

theme: Lecturing and a return to political tech

projects.name: Compass
projects.blurb: Collaborating with designer Rosalba Ellis I developed a new website for the centre-left thinktank Compass.

projects.name: Democracy Club's Election Widget
projects.blurb: Working in a distributed team well before it was trendy, I collaborated with the team at Democracy Club to develop a fully unit-tested, accessible polling station finder and election information widget in time for the 2019 election.

projects.name: Can I Vote?
projects.blurb: Another project for the 2019 election, Can I Vote highlighted to Commonwealth citizens that they are eligible to vote in UK elections.
